name: Path T Melanoma Skin
title: Pathologic T
notes:
**Note 1:** pTX includes shave biopsies and regressed melanomas.

**Note 2:**  Assign the higher T if there is a discrepancy between the Clark level and the pathologic description of extent (invasion into the layers of the dermis).

**Note 3:**  Code the greatest extent of invasion from any procedure performed on the lesion, whether it is described as a biopsy or an excision.  

**Note 4:**  Satellite lesions/nodules or in-transit metastases are coded in regional lymph nodes.

**Note 5:** Breslow's depth is coded in **Site-Specific Factor 1, Measured Thickness (Depth), Breslow Measurement.**

**Note 6:**  Ulceration of the melanoma is coded in **Site-Specific Factor 2, Ulceration.**
footnotes: ^ Definition from the updated pages from [TNM Classification of Malignant Tumours, Seventh edition](http://www.wileyanduicc.com/pdf/Corrected_pages.pdf)
rows:

    Physician unable to assess T
    Surgical resection of primary tumor, depth not stated
Physician assigns pTX, no other information available to determine T

Melanomas diagnosed via shave biopsy
Regressed melanoma

Melanoma in situ (Clark Level I) 
    Atypical melanocytic hyperplasia
    Several melanocytic dysplasia
    Not an invasive malignant lesion

Intraepidermal, intraepithelial, noninvasive 
(Basement membrane of the epidermis is intact)

Stated as Tis
Tumor 1 mm or less in thickness

Note: T1 has subcategories of T1a and T1b. Assign T1 only when there is no information available to assign one of the subcategories

Skin/dermis, NOS
Localized, NOS

Stated as T1 [NOS]
Without ulceration and mitosis less than 1mm (squared)^

Papillary dermis invaded (Clark level II) WITHOUT ulceration or UNKNOWN if ulceration

Papillary-reticular dermal interface invaded (Clark level III) 
WITHOUT ulceration or UNKNOWN if ulceration

Stated as T1a
With ulceration or mitoses equal to or greater than 1mm (squared)^

Papillary dermis invaded (Clark level II) WITH ulceration 
Papillary-reticular dermal interface invaded (Clark level III) 
WITH ulceration 

Reticular dermis invaded (Clark level IV) WITH or WITHOUT ulceration

Subcutaneous tissue invaded (through entire dermis) (Clark's level V) WITH or WITHOUT ulceration

Stated as T1b
Tumor more than 1 mm but not more than 2 mm in thickness

Note: T2 has subcategories of T2a and T2b. Assign T2 only when there is no information available to assign one of the subcategories

Stated as T2 [NOS]
Tumor more than 2 mm but not more than 4 mm in thickness

Note: T3 has subcategories of T3a and T3b. Assign T3 only when there is no information available to assign one of the subcategories

Stated as T3 [NOS]
Tumor more than 4 mm in thickness

Note: T4 has subcategories of T4a and T4b. Assign T4 only when there is no information available to assign one of the subcategories

Stated as T4 [NOS]

Further contiguous extension:
Underlying cartilage, bone, skeletal muscle WITHOUT ulceration

Stated as T4a

Further contiguous extension:
Underlying cartilage, bone, skeletal muscle WITH ulceration

Stated as T4b

Pathologic classification criteria not met
